item.title: Attributes on lambda methods
item.description: Daily Knowledge Drop Introduced with C#10, attributes can also be applied to lambda expressions and lambda parameters. Attribute For our example, a method level attribute has been created, which can be used to mark a method for logging (this is just an example, no actual logging will be demonstrated in this post): 1 2 3 4 5 [AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Method, AllowMultiple = true)] class LoggingEnabledAttribute : Attribute { // marker attribute to flag this method should be logged } Attribute application This attribute, configured to target methods (using another attribute, AttributeUsage) can now be applied to any method:
